intro: Enantia, commonly known as the African star, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Rubiaceae. It consists of several species, most notably Enantia chlorantha, which is native to sub-Saharan Africa. These plants are characterized by their striking, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. They typically grow as shrubs or small trees, often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Enantia species are valued for their ornamental beauty and have traditional uses in some African cultures.
